p: Urban food systems and value chains showed clear indications of a lack of resilience—driving consumer prices up and exacerbating urban poverty. The implication was food insecurity, most especially amongst the urban poor. A recent report showed that state-level mobility restrictions reduced the probability of non-farm business activity participation by 11% and increase the household experience of food insecurity by 13% (Amare et al. 2021). And the restriction led to income losses and a reduction in purchasing power amongst the poorest households (Béné 2020).
